Data: Australia win the toss and will bowl
Stanlake to Roy, 1 run full outside leg stump, clipped down to long leg
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run back of a length, straight, Bairstow misses his attempt to work to the leg side and taken high on the pad
Stanlake to Bairstow, 1 run full at the toes, angling down the leg side, clipped to long leg...clocks in at 91mph
Stanlake to Roy, 2 runs nice piece of timing as he plays forward into a length ball and sends it straight of mid-off
Stanlake to Roy, no run full and straight, 92.8mph, clipped to midwicket
Stanlake to Roy, no run back of a length outside off, left alone, carries at waist height to the patched up Tim Paine
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run short of a length, at off stump, defended
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 2 runs just short of a length, Bairstow swings away a pull which goes quite fine towards long leg...takes more bottom edge than middle
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs top shot! A full delivery at off stump, Bairstow gets a stride forward and drives it straight of mid-off
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run played on the up this time, wasn't quite as full, bat twists a touch in his hands and the ball runs to mid-on

Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs full and wide, flayed over the covers! Wasn't a million miles from a diving Agar as he flew to his right but Bairstow just placed it well enough as he threw his hands through the delivery
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs straightens the line but that's a wonderful piece of timing as he flicks the wrists and sends it between midwicket and mid-on. Bairstow is up and running
Stanlake to Roy, no run back of a length outside off, defended to backward point

Stanlake to Roy, 2 runs offers up some width outside off, Roy drives hard and it flies off a thickish outside part of the bat over backward point. Third man, Andrew Tye, gets a boot to it, old-style fielding!
Stanlake to Roy, no run nicely bowled, short of a length and nips back at Roy, 90mph, defended to the off side
Stanlake to Roy, no run back of a length at off stump, played to mid-on
Stanlake to Roy, no run onto the back foot and punches this into the covers
Stanlake to Roy, no run good shot, and good fielding...Roy gets onto the front foot to a full delivery and drives sweetly, but Stoinis at mid-off does well
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run swing and a miss from Bairstow as he aims to pull a short-of-a-length delivery, the ball scoots under the bottom edge
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run good length at off stump, driven to mid-off
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a bouncer, the first of the day, angles over leg stump as Bairstow ducs
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run back of a length outside off, driven square from the back foot to point
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a straight delivery, avoiding a driveable length, played into midwicket
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs can't finish out the over, drops a fraction short, Bairstow is quickly on it and plays a well-controlled pull behind square
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs full on the pads, that's a gift, clipped sweetly through square leg
Stanlake to Roy, no run short of a length outside off, forced at the top of the bounce with a straight bat back to the bowler
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs goes for the pull, doesn't get it out of the middle, skews off a top edge over midwicket but has the legs to reach the boundary
Stanlake to Roy, SIX runs he's nailed that one! No doubt that came out of the middle. Short again from Stanlake and it's a crunching pull over deep square leg

Stanlake to Roy, no run huge appeal for caught! Given not out and Paine has called the review straightaway. He's convinced. Terrific delivery, short of a length and nipping back at Roy, cuts him in half. Is it inside edge or trouser pocket? Appears to miss the bat
Stanlake to Roy, no run angled in at off stump, 92mph, full length and driven to mid-on
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a bouncer, flies through to Paine, can't be far from a wide but he gets away with it
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to cover
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run just short of a good length, angling in from outside off, driven to mid-off
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run aims to force this through the off side, takes a thick inside edge into the pads
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run short, ducked...he has a skiddy short delivery
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run another short one, Bairstow ducks, and this time he's able to complete a maiden. Good effort
Agar to Roy, no run round the wicket, full at middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
Agar to Roy, no run goes for an expansive drive and inside edges into his pads
Agar to Roy, no run slides on with the arm from round the wicket, defended to cover
Agar to Roy, no run touch fuller, driven off the front foot...dot balls lining up
Agar to Roy, 2 runs uses his feet, can't quite get to the pitch, tucks it through square leg
Agar to Roy, 1 run down the pitch again, pushes firmly towards mid-on, quick single, the throw deflects off Bairstow so they decline any overthrows
Jhye Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs delightful shot! Was a half volley there to hit, Roy gets a good stride forward and dispatches it between cover and mid-off
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run drags the length back, defended to cover
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run defended with an angled bat into backward point
Jhye Richardson to Roy, SIX runs that's huge! Way back into the stands over long leg. A short ball, Roy latches on and hooks with immense power. It's tennis season, new balls please!
Jhye Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs and he follows it with a crisp back-foot drive! Richardson takes his line outside off, short of a length, Roy on the back foot and goes wide of point
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run short of a length, straight, defended
Agar to Bairstow, no run pushes a straight delivery back to the bowler
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs gets well across onto off stump and sweeps this well wide of short fine leg, excellent placement
Agar to Bairstow, 1 wide tries for a repeat of the short, misses out this time, ball skids down the leg side and is called wide
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs

Agar to Bairstow, no run given this time, Agar hits back! Going for another sweep, although Bairstow has called the review. This looked pretty good. Doesn't hit the bat, misses the glove as well. Although the third umpire is checking that again. It's very close to
Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs angled into the pads, bunted with a straight bat through the leg side
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run worked through the leg side
Tye to Bairstow, no run

Tye to Bairstow, 2 runs dropped! By Stoinis running back from mid-off. Would have been an excellent catch, over his shoulder, running back and he does all the hard work to get there but then can't grab it. Bairstow trying to launch down the ground
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs insult to injury for Australia as Bairstow not back cuts this between backward point and short third
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs runs are flowing! Short, wide again from Tye, Bairstow cuts it square through the off side
Tye to Bairstow, 2 runs stands tall and again drives square through the off side to deep point
Tye to Bairstow, no run can't find the gap this time as he steers a length delivery with an open face to backward point
Agar to Roy, no run goes for the reverse sweep, plays it into the ground and bounces to point
Agar to Roy, no run driven to mid-on
Agar to Roy, 1 run dragged down a touch shorter, angled into the pads, pushed with a straight bat to long-on
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs too short from Agar and Bairstow puts it away through the covers, wide of the sweeper, more swift footwork to get him into position
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run gets forward and pushes to the covers
Agar to Roy, 1 run drives a short delivery to deep cover
Maxwell to Roy, 1 run over the wicket, pushed to deep midwicket
Maxwell to Bairstow, 1 run slides into the pads, nudged to midwicket
Maxwell to Roy, 1 run goes back outside leg stump, Maxwell keeps it tight to the batsman, pushed down the ground
Maxwell to Bairstow, 1 run flicks a straight ball into the leg side, they think about the second but Maxwell chases it down
Maxwell to Roy, no run steps back well outside off and slaps this very firmly back to the bowler
Maxwell to Roy, no run fired towards leg stump and follows run as he tries to pull
Agar to Bairstow, no run full and straight, drives with a thick inside edge into the pad and it bobbles to the off side
Agar to Bairstow, no run full at middle and leg, pushed to cover
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run drives down to long-off and that's a 39-ball fifty for Bairstow as his supreme form continues. That knee's okay today
Agar to Roy, no run good length outside off, defended
Agar to Roy, 1 run steps back outside leg stump to free up the off side, drives to deep cover from what was a pretty straight delivery
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs
Maxwell to Roy, SIX runs that's a mighty blow over long-on, he rocks back in the crease and heaves it with a straight bat down the ground. Hundred up for England
Maxwell to Roy, 2 runs tucked through midwicket and that's swift running
Maxwell to Roy, 1 run short of a length outside off, pushed to deep cover and that's fifty for Roy off 41 balls. Excellent follow-up to the century
Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX runs that's just eased over wide long-off! Dismissive batting. Moves to the leg side, opens up the off, and drives inside-out over the off side
Maxwell to Bairstow, 1 run shorter, flatter, puihed off the back foot to the covers
Maxwell to Roy, 1 run pushed down the ground to long-on
Stanlake to Roy, no run back of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
Stanlake to Roy, no run short of a length outside off, cracked off the back foot to cover
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs flat-batted straight of mid-off! An extraordinary shot from Roy. Was short of a length outside off, he plays it off the back foot straight back past the bolwer
Stanlake to Roy, 1 run short, at the body, angled down to third man
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run back of a length, 89mph, straight, pushed to mid-off
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run cuts a shortish delivery into the ground and it bounces towards point
Stoinis to Roy, no run
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs superb fielding! Bairstow pulled a short ball through square leg, was in the air for a while but never catch, however Short pulls off a brilliant one-handed save
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run flicked off the stumps into midwicket
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run short of a length, 79mph, pushed off the back foot towards mid-on
Stoinis to Roy, no run
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run gets beaten over the top edge as he drives on the up outside off
Stanlake to Bairstow, 1 run full at off stump, a very good-looking drive which finds mid-off on the edge of the circle
Stanlake to Roy, FOUR runs flayed over the off side off the front foot
Stanlake to Roy, 1 run deflects off his thigh pad down by his feet and he's called through for a quick single
Stanlake to Bairstow, no run short outside off, left alone
Stanlake to Bairstow, 2 runs more good fielding on the boundary, clipped sweetly off the pads behind square, appears it will bisect long and deep square but D'Arcy Short again the man with the dive
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs short on the pads, worked out to deep square leg...scamper back for a second. These two are quick between the wickets

Stoinis to Roy, FOUR runs just clears mid-off and the boundaries keep coming...the bottom hand takes over as he drives this full delivery, a flick of the wrists to get it over the infield, and he just gets the elevation needed
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run full, worked off the pads to deep square
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run push-and-run towards mid-off
Stoinis to Roy, 2 runs back of a length at off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
Stoinis to Roy, 1 leg bye plays it down by his feet, doesn't take any bat, comes off the thigh pad
Tye to Roy, SIX runs stand and deliver! An effortless, lofted straight drive as Tye goes full and it's into the stands over long-on
Tye to Roy, 2 runs full outside off, driven down the ground and long-on can't stop the second
Tye to Roy, 1 run full outside off, a slower ball, driven off the toe end to mid-off and that's the 150 up
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs hammered through the leg side! Short of a length outside off, Bairstow fetches his pull well in front of square
Tye to Bairstow, 2 runs fuller, worked off the pads through midwicket, wide of long-on to his right this time. Terrific placement
Tye to Bairstow, no run full at off stump, driven to cover
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run back of a length, straight, nudged to deep square
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run pulled down to long leg

Stoinis to Roy, 1 run, OUT has he run himself out?! Yes, he has A break for Australia and Roy is well short. Wasteful from him, but it's Short at deep square again who's pulled off the run out. He's been superb the last few overs. Roy was the one who called for th
Stoinis to Hales, no run short ball first up to Hales, outside off, he ignores it
Stoinis to Hales, no run good length ball, gets forward and pushes to point
Stoinis to Hales, no run full outside off, driven to mid-off
Finch to Bairstow, 1 run calmly driven into the covers
Finch to Hales, no run square driven to point
Finch to Hales, no run onto the front foot and pressed into the off side
Finch to Hales, 1 run squeezed back past the bowler, who is really rattling through this over
Finch to Bairstow, 1 run on the back foot, punched firmly back past the bowler once more
Finch to Hales, FOUR runs down on one knee, and slapped handsomely through midwicket! A clumping finish to an otherwise effective over
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run tucked to the leg side
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs sweet timing and placement! Straying onto the pads and just eased in front of midwicket... no stopping that!
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs this is some stunning timing from Hales! So little wrong with the delivery, but Hales' timing and placement was out of this world! Clean through the covers
Stoinis to Hales, no run on the back foot, solid block down into the crease
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs outside off, slammed through backward point
Stoinis to Hales, 1 wide banged in short, too short
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run on the pads, clipped through backward square
Jhye Richardson to Hales, FOUR runs short, wide, battered through point! This is brutality
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run a play and a miss! Outside off, a flat-footed poke to a good-length delivery
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run well bowled again! He's found a nice length here, angling into the batsman and sneaking past the edge again
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run flogged off the back foot to the cover sweeper
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run attempted pull but he's through the shot too soon. Paine does well to snaffle the deflection off the thigh pad with a stretch to his right
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, SIX runs that first shot was merely a dress rehearsal! Short once more, Bairstow nails this one clean into the midwicket stands!
Short to Hales, 1 run nurdled off the legs
Short to Bairstow, 1 run clipped urgently to the leg side, but just the single there
Short to Hales, 1 run looped into the toes, and flicked out to midwicket. Effective stuff so far...
Short to Bairstow, no run attempted sweep, rattles off the pad, looking for the single but it's not on there
Short to Bairstow, SIX runs in the slot and over extra cover! A fine crowd catch to complete the show. England just keep rampaging onwards
Short to Bairstow, 1 run tapped into the covers. It's been a decent over, but it's still gone for 10...
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run a looping slower ball, picked from the hand and punched into the off side
Tye to Hales, no run back of a length, angled into the legs, dabbed back down the track
Tye to Hales, no run firm defence on the back foot, this is good bowling
Tye to Hales, no run good areas once again, as Hales clips firmly off the legs but straight to short midwicket
Tye to Hales, no run slower ball, right up in the blockhole, and duly blocked
Tye to Hales, no run thumped firmly to mid-off, just a single off the over! Shocking
Short to Bairstow, no run attempted sweep but can't get it away
Short to Bairstow, 1 run decent length, tucked to leg for the single
Short to Hales, 1 run down on one knee for the sweep, struck outside the line as the ball deflects to the man on the 45
Short to Bairstow, SIX runs what a way to bring up the hundred! Clears the front leg and flogs it high over cow corner! His fourth in six innings, and he is absolutely flying!
Short to Bairstow, 1 run flicked through midwicket
Short to Hales, FOUR runs another pumping drive through long-off! There's no stopping England
Tye to Bairstow, no run cracked hard into the covers
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs banged in short, slapped dismissively through point
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run a wristy flick out through square leg

Tye to Hales, SIX runs a massive top-edge, but Hales gets away with it! It plops over the short boundary on the Radcliffe Road side, and is very uncomfortably held by a bloke in an Aussie cap ... good effort fella!
Tye to Hales, no run tucked out to short midwicket
Tye to Hales, no run drilled on the up, but straight to mid-off
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run tossed up and tucked to the leg side
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run well bowled, ducking back into Hales who adjusts his stroke to press a back-foot drive to cover
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run on the toes, clipped to the leg side
Stoinis to Hales, 2 runs too much width once more, but the cover sweeper sprints round to intercept another hooning cut
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs bosh! In the slot, hammered on the up, clean over the covers!
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run tickled off the legs, behind square once more
Agar to Hales, no run tucked out to the leg side
Agar to Hales, no run wider line, chopped straight to backward point
Agar to Hales, 1 leg bye beaten! Hales is struck on the back pad, very adjacent to middle, but it seems to be sliding over
Agar to Bairstow, no run crunched to cover
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run driven down to long-off
Agar to Hales, no run can't beat Maxwell with an inside-out drive
Stoinis to Bairstow, SIX runs good lord, that is a clean strike! Very little wrong with the ball, but Bairstow stays leg side, frees the hands, and clubs it mightily over long-off!
Stoinis to Bairstow, FOUR runs crashed in front of the midwicket sweeper! Just a fraction too short, and Stoinis pays the price
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run another spanking drive, but straight at short cover this time
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs inswinging yorker, but misses the length by just a fraction. Clipped to the leg side, and up comes the 250 ...
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run swished out through backward square
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run pushed on the up, angling into the leg side... another single
Agar to Hales, SIX runs ab-so-lute-lee massive! Hales shimmies down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, flogs high and violently over the bowler's head to bring up his fifty!
Agar to Hales, 1 run down on one knee, crashed through the leg side
Agar to Bairstow, 3 runs driven on the up, out to deep cover. Good committed fielding to cut off the boundary
Agar to Hales, 1 run on the back foot, clumped to long-on
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run a pre-meditated sweep, and just short of short fine leg! Bairstow would have been livid to get out that way!
Agar to Hales, FOUR runs excellent improvisation, as Hales drops for the sweep, finds himself having to adjust for a half-tracker, and hauling a kneeling pull behind square
Tye to Bairstow, no run back of a length, pops a touch, and defended back down the pitch
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs flogged on the up over the covers!
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run out to deep cover
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs too short, sticks in the pitch, lambasted with a cross-batted mow over the leg side!
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs too wide, slashed through the vacant third man. Australia need 18 fielders to plug the gaps
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs banged in short, smashed out through the leg side. This is carnage!
Tye to Morgan, 1 run full at off stump, actually comes off the toe as he swings out to deep midwicket
Tye to Hales, 2 runs full, wide outside off, he walks across the crease and angles down to third man
Tye to Hales, 1 run a slower ball outside off, driven down the ground
Tye to Morgan, 1 bye well bowled, gets a yorker under Morgan's bat, beats leg stump and then Paine palms it away

Tye to Hales, (no ball) 1 run caught off a no-ball, called for height...big full toss from Tye, Hales was coming down the pitch, umpire's decide it would have been above waist height in his normal stance. Took a top edge as Hales swung at it.
Tye to Morgan, 1 run and the free hit is swung out to deep midwicket
Tye to Hales, no run plays over the top of a yorker outside off stump...a few decent deliveries in the last couple of overs
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, 1 run a yorker at off stump, dug out into the off side

Jhye Richardson to Hales, OUT taken at deep midwicket...Hales had just started to lose his shape in the last few minutes. He heaves a length delivery a long way into the air and it's comfortably taken
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, OUT two wickets in two balls...Morgan tries to take this from outside off over the leg side, goes very high in the air and Paine settles under the catch
Jhye Richardson to Ali, 1 run a low full toss is driven down the ground
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run full and straight, driven to cover on the edge of a circle
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run carved over the off side out to deep point
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs down on one knee, pounded behind square!
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run outside off, and crunched into the off side
Agar to Hales, no run full stride, solid defence. A very incongruous stroke in the circumstances!
Agar to Hales, no run attempted slash into the covers
Agar to Hales, 1 leg bye round the wicket, angled into the pads
Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs on the legs, worked to midwicket
Stanlake to Hales, SIX runs round the wicket, into the stands! Utterly dismissive, Hales' stance was almost set for the shot before the ball was bowled, in the slot and over midwicket!
Stanlake to Hales, FOUR runs banged in short, the angle sends it skidding into another murderous pull through the leg side!
Stanlake to Hales, 1 run fuller length, outside off, slashed to deep cover
Stanlake to Bairstow, 1 run short again, a roundhouse pull, out to deep square leg
Stanlake to Hales, 2 runs pounded high and mightily into the leg side, more height than might in fact ... more of a sand wedge out to no-man's land at cow corner

Stanlake to Hales, 2 runs completely different shot, exactly the same result! A top-edged pull, sails harmlessly out to deep midwicket and plugs between two converging fielders. He's toying with them now!
Stoinis to Root, 1 run full outside off, steered to backward point with an open face
Stoinis to Ali, 1 run swings a low full toss out to deep square leg
Stoinis to Root, 1 run full and outside off, chopped down to third man
Stoinis to Ali, 2 runs a slower ball banged in short, Moeen has to hold his shot for a moment then hooks to fine leg

Stoinis to Ali, (no ball) 2 runs taken at deep midwicket, it's another big full toss, and the umpires are checking for height...it's borderline, but this is called no-ball as well. Langer has a rueful smile on the balcony
Stoinis to Ali, 4 leg byes and the free hit is full outside leg stump, Moeen misses his flick but it deflects off the pad wide of Paine
Stoinis to Ali, 1 wide a slower short ball and it balloons over Moeen's head...called wide on height
Stoinis to Ali, no run he's defeated by another slower ball, full outside off, which he drives over the top of
Tye to Root, 1 run heaves a length ball high into the leg side, no timing at all, and falls short of long-on
Tye to Ali, 2 runs crunches a length ball from outside off straight down the ground, long-off can't stop the second
Tye to Ali, 2 runs full, wide outside off, a one handed drive over cover, the sweep cuts it off and despite a fumble keeps them to two
Tye to Ali, 1 run full at off stump, good delivery, driven into the covers
Tye to Root, OUT and Moeen is run out by Paine's under arm throw from behind the stumps...Root had a swing and a miss, another slower ball, and Paine shows his ten-pin bowling skills
Tye to Willey, 1 run full outside off, driven to cover on the circle...Tye brings up his century
I'm off to catch by breath for a while and Miller will be back with you for the start of Australia's chase

Phew, what a 50 overs that was! England have set a new world record for men's ODIs, breaking their own mark of 444, with thunderous hundreds from Bairstow and Hales. They were on for 500 before Australia finally started to get their yorkers in during the final few overs,
Welcome back, folks. Actually Gnasher to start the innings. Mark Wood with the ball
Wood to Short, 1 run full outside off, driven into the pitch and it runs into point
Wood to Head, 3 runs driven nicely through the covers, Plunkett chases it down from mid-off
Wood to Short, no run keeps it full, Short gets forward and drives to mid-off
Wood to Short, no run full at the stumps, searching for some swing, again he drives to mid-off
Wood to Short, 1 run back of a length, straight, pushed to the right of mid-off
Wood to Head, 1 wide full outside leg stump, Head misses his flick and it's called a wide
Wood to Head, no run good length at middle and off, defended into midwicket
Willey to Short, SIX runs driven over cover for six! Full outside off, a hint of swing, a terrific response from Short as he just drives through the line over the off side
Willey to Short, FOUR runs and this one is on the up! Challenge laid down by Short. Willey drags the length back but Short just lofts it over the off-side ring. Lovely shot
Willey to Short, 1 run gets the yorker in at middle and off, dug out towards mid-on
Willey to Head, 1 run big appeal for lbw, a good length ball that is trapped off the inside edge
Willey to Short, 1 wide pushed down the leg side...another wide
Willey to Short, 1 run gets away with this, a good length angled into the pads, flicked towards short fine leg
Willey to Head, 1 run back of a length, straight, worked to deep square leg. Willey's first over goes for 15. They need a few more of them
Wood to Head, FOUR runs width, slashed. High over cover! Australia still on the rampage!
Wood to Head, no run tighter line, on off stump and stoutly blocked
Wood to Head, 1 run onto the front foot, and clumped into the covers
Wood to Short, no run sharp bouncer, Short swings into a pull but it's through him
Wood to Short, no run back of a length, on the pads, tucked to square leg
Wood to Short, 1 run leaning back to dab through third man
Willey to Marsh, no run clipped to the leg side
Willey to Marsh, 2 runs swinging into the pads, nurdled off the hip out through square leg
Willey to Marsh, 1 wide swinging down the leg side, Willey is trying to cramp the left-hander for room, but overcooks it on this occasion
Willey to Marsh, no run back of a length, on off stump, and jabbed firmly to point
Willey to Marsh, 1 run nipping into the pads, and deflected to short third man. They all count
Willey to Head, 1 run clipped to the leg side
Wood to Head, FOUR runs whipped from off stump to backward square, shimmying across the stumps to create the angle. Cleverly played
Wood to Head, no run fuller length, angled across, attacking the top of off, and deflected to backward point
Wood to Head, no run short, sharp, and that's slammed into Head's neck... via the collarbone. Ouch!
Wood to Head, no run crunched hard into the covers
Wood to Head, no run on the back foot, that's a good line to go with the shorter length, and that was 90mph from Wood, who is picking up pace as he finds his rhythm
Wood to Head, 1 run back-foot punch to mid-off
Willey to Head, no run good zip from Willey, skidding past an attempted cut, too close to make contact
Willey to Head, 1 run on the pads, clipped to midwicket
Willey to Marsh, no run good line from Willey, just back of a length, outside off and angling in. Defended back to the bowler
Willey to Marsh, 1 leg bye big appeal as Willey nips one back into the pads, he was stuck on the crease, but it looked to be going over
Willey to Head, FOUR runs well played, he's picked off that shot well, just walking across the stumps and finding the angle through fine leg
Willey to Head, no run climbing through to the keeper, outside off, but can't make contact
Root to Marsh, 1 run angling into the stumps from round the wicket, tapped to mid-on
Root to Head, FOUR runs makes room for a slash over the covers, doesn't quite connect but finds acres of space out at extra cover, as the ball rolls into the rope
Root to Head, 1 run tucked to the leg side
Root to Marsh, 1 run flicked out to the leg side once more
Root to Head, 1 run dances down the pitch, looking for something big but settling for a clip to leg
Root to Marsh, 1 run eased down to long-on, singles won't suffice for Australia ... and it's only the seventh over!
Willey to Marsh, 1 run a touch of width outside off, and thumped on the up into the covers
Willey to Head, FOUR runs width, and crashed into the gap at third man... Australia keep ticking along
Willey to Head, 1 wide sliding down the leg side
Willey to Head, 1 run flashed into the covers
Willey to Marsh, 1 wide swinging down leg once more. A bit meh from Willey in this over
Willey to Marsh, no run up on the toes, that's a better line, and defended back down the pitch
Willey to Marsh, 1 run crashed into the covers, a good sliding stop

Willey to Head, FOUR runs too much width from Willey, who is caught between swinging down leg and starting too far outside off. It's the latter error this time, and an open-faced glide beats backward point
Root to Marsh, SIX runs tremendous use of the feet! Dancing down the deck, right to the pitch of the ball, and slotted back over the bowler's head
Root to Marsh, no run fended back down the pitch
Root to Marsh, 1 run speared into the toes, clipped to the leg side
Root to Head, 1 run advancing once again, and eased down to long-on
Root to Marsh, 1 run back of a length, tapped to the leg side, they scamper the quick single
Root to Head, 1 run short but straight, cut firmly to point
Wood to Head, 1 run well bowled from Wood, skidding on from a middle-and-leg line, and defended to point
Wood to Marsh, no run tight lines once more, up on the toes to defend on off stump
Wood to Marsh, 1 run well bowled once more, zipping through, and inside-edged through to the keeper, who flings off a glove to take a shy, but the batsman is home
Wood to Head, FOUR runs a batsman swing through the line, clean in front of square on the leg side
Wood to Head, 1 run whipped off the legs to backward square
Wood to Marsh, 1 run pushed onto the back foot, fenced to third man. Australia are keeping apace of the requirement for now
Ali to Marsh, no run stabbed back to the bowler
Ali to Marsh, 1 run opens the face to guide the ball to point
Ali to Head, 1 run defended down the ground to long on
Ali to Marsh, 1 run too short and flogged hard along the ground to the midwicket sweeper
Ali to Head, no run tossed up, dipping into the blockhole, enticing stuff
Ali to Head, 1 run held back a touch in the flight, Head advances and clips to long on
Wood to Head, 1 run flipped out to midwicket from deep in the crease
Wood to Marsh, 1 run pushed off the back foot to mid-off
Wood to Head, no run short and sharp, Head flinches inside the line as the ball gets big on him
Wood to Head, 1 wide sharp pace, but down the leg side. Half an appeal for the strangle down the leg side, but that was mostly to distract from the wide
Wood to Head, 2 runs whipped urgently off the hip to deep midwicket
Wood to Head, 2 runs thumped into the covers and up comes a very well compiled fifty. Head is taking this chase head-on
Wood to Head, no run pulled hard, but straight to the man at midwicket
Ali to Marsh, 1 run on the back foot, flicked to the leg side
Ali to Head, no run drawn down the pitch, Moeen holds this one back, and midwicket gathers the delicate flick off the pads
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run pushed out to cover and Stoinis is off the mark
Ali to Marsh, 1 run thumped uppishly to long-off
Ali to Stoinis, no run solidly into line
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 leg bye very full, swinging into the pads, and they scamper the single
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run poked back down the pitch, and Plunkett sticks out a mitt to half-stop
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run nudged to the leg side
Plunkett to Marsh, no run firmly bashed back down the pitch
Plunkett to Marsh, no run inside-edge onto the pads as Plunkett comes round the wicket to the left-hander
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run over the wicket now, and mown out to deep backward square. A good heavy-balled first over

Ali to Marsh, OUT hoisted high and mightily down the ground ... but Plunkett is perched on the rope, and swallows the opportunity! Just didn't quite get enough bat through the ball, and for all Australia's intent, they are in peril now
Ali to Finch, no run outside off, and tweaking back into a back-foot push
Ali to Finch, 1 run onto the front foot this time, and pushed to mid-off
Ali to Stoinis, FOUR runs delicate from Stoinis, a pre-meditated reverse sweep, gets it very fine, and Rashid can't cut that off
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run a hint of spin from outside off, Stoinis hits with the turn and places it to mid-on
Ali to Finch, no run on the back foot, defended back down the pitch
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run hoicked behind square
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run flicked to the leg side
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run wider on the crease, fuller length, blocked to mid-on
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run slower ball, on the pads, tucked out to deep square leg
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run thumped off the back foot, but straight to mid-off
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run slower ball again, dug into the pitch and hauled into the leg side
Ali to Stoinis, SIX runs massive! Down on one knee, pounded into the stands, where there's a very good crowd catch. Scenes!
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run worked out to the deep
Ali to Finch, 1 run pushed to cover
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length, dabbed to third man
Ali to Finch, 1 run flicked off the toes, out to backward square
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run opens the face for a glide to third man
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run short, goes for the pull and it's in the air for a while but short of long leg
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run good length outside off, pushed to cover for a quick single. There's a direct hit from Morgan but Stoinis well home
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run full outside off, goes for the drive and it skews off a fat outside edge down to third man
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run that's a neat pull off the hip down to long leg
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run short again, a slower ball this time, he's through his shot early and the ball dribbles to midwicket
Plunkett to Finch, no run very full outside off, sweetly driven square of the wicket but well stopped by Roy at point
Rashid to Stoinis, no run plays back to a shortish delivery and defends to midwicket
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run whipped down to long-on
Rashid to Finch, 1 run outside off this time, still a touch short, cut to deep cover
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run fuller, driven down to long-on
Rashid to Finch, no run goes for a square cut to a delivery that skids on and beats the bottom edge

Rashid to Finch, no run just short of the bowler as Finch gets a leading edge, looking to work into the leg side, turns the face of his bat, loops down the on-side of the pitch and Rashid can't quite reach it. Good effort
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run that flies through to Buttler from short of a length, wasn't a full on bouncer, beats the top edge of Stoinis who wanted the wide call
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run fuller, angled into the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
Plunkett to Finch, 2 leg byes gets inside the line and nudges this off his hip to deep square and makes it into a second
Plunkett to Finch, SIX runs lovely wrist work from Finch, whips a back-of-a-length delivery behind square on the leg side and he's timed it perfectly
Plunkett to Finch, no run back of a length outside off, he adjust the line, defended to cover
Plunkett to Finch, 4 leg byes angled down the leg side, that's a poor delivery, doesn't make contact with the bat but deflects off the thigh guard to fine leg
Rashid to Stoinis, 2 runs full outside off, driven firmly to long-off but excellent running makes it a brace
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run good length, straight, tapped to the off side
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs that's muscled down the ground over long-on...Finch stayed in his crease and just levered through the line from a strong base

Rashid to Finch, OUT done him this time! He tosses it up much slower, Finch goes for another big shot down the ground and is completely done in the air. Lovely stuff from the leggie, even if he does have the cushion of a mountain of runs
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run full and straight, driven down to long-off
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run touch short, pulled out to deep midwicket
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run back of a length at off stump, played to the bowler
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run takes this from around off stump into the leg side
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run short at off stump, 83mph, Maxwell defends on his toes towards point and is keen for the run but it's not there
Plunkett to Maxwell, 1 run some whippage from Maxwell as he tucks this from outside off to deep square leg
Plunkett to Stoinis, FOUR runs goes for the pull, drags it from outside off, doesn't connect perfectly but it finds space at deep midwicket

Plunkett to Stoinis, FOUR runs that's gone miles in the air! Stoinis unleashes a big drive down the ground, the delivery isn't that full, and it ends up almost plugging in front of the rope but trickles over in the end
Rashid to Maxwell, no run full and straight, driven to cover
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run touch shorter, he goes back on leg stump, crunched very firmly towards cover who takes the pace off it
Rashid to Stoinis, no run quite full at leg stump, he plays back and defends
Rashid to Stoinis, no run there's the googly, he plays back and punches off the back foot to cover
Rashid to Stoinis, no run brilliant work at cover! A flatter delivery is driven firmly and Roy flings himself to his right
Rashid to Stoinis, FOUR runs there's some power in that! Full, touch too wide outside off, and Stoinis responds with a skimming drive wide of the cover sweeper

Willey to Maxwell, 1 leg bye over the wicket, outside leg stump, takes the pad towards short fine leg and a poor piece of cricket allows an overthrow as Rashid throws at the stumps and it deflects away
Willey to Stoinis, no run short of a length on the pads, dangerous line, flicked straight to short fine leg. Rashid throws again with the batsman in no danger
Willey to Stoinis, 1 run straighter line, tucked into midwicket

Willey to Maxwell, 1 run heaves to the leg side against a pretty full delivery, takes a thick inside edge into midwicket. Willey chases, collects and throws at the stumps himself (worth it on this occasion...just)
Willey to Stoinis, no run short of a length and he cloths his pull to midwicket

Willey to Stoinis, 1 run, OUT he's been run out here! An excellent throw from Bairstow coming in from deep square. Stoinis hopped inside the line, worked the ball to deeps square, Maxwell called him back for the second and he's sold Stoinis well short. Bullet arm
Rashid to Maxwell, no run tossed up at the stumps and driven to cover
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives in the air over cover
Rashid to Paine, 1 run full and straight, pushed down the ground to long-on
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 leg bye goes for the reverse sweep, takes the pad to short third man
Rashid to Paine, 1 run pushed into the pads, worked out to deep square
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run moves outside leg and square drives to the cover sweeper
Willey to Maxwell, 1 run driven to mid-off
Willey to Paine, 1 run short at the body, knocked down into the leg side
Willey to Maxwell, SIX runs a scoop for six! Moves well across his crease to a back-of-a-length delivery and sends it back over Buttler's head
Willey to Maxwell, no run goes full at off stump, driven to mid-off
Willey to Maxwell, 1 run full at the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
Willey to Paine, 1 run outside leg stump and flicked to long leg
Rashid to Paine, no run full at off stump, driven to cover where Roy again fields very well
Rashid to Paine, no run the googly, he plays back and works to midwicket
Rashid to Paine, no run waits for this leg-break to turn from off stump but picks out cover off the back foot
Rashid to Paine, 1 run full at middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run moves outside leg stump, loses his shape on the drive, bottom hand comes off the bat as it skews to long-off

Rashid to Paine, OUT he's basically pulled a long hop to deep square! Good catch by Hales. A drag down from Rashid, Paine only had one man to beat on the leg side but couldn't keep the ball down and Hales moved to his right to snaffle the take
Willey to Maxwell, FOUR runs that's a lovely little shot, a ball angling across him, short of a length, and it's a delicate dab wide of the keeper
Willey to Maxwell, no run backs away to the leg side and drives into the point area
Willey to Jhye Richardson, no run short from over the wicket, he hops behind the line and defends to the leg side
Willey to Jhye Richardson, 1 run short outside off, neatly punched from the back foot to deep point
Willey to Agar, no run back of a length at off stump, defended
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, no run full at off stump, he lunges forward and defends
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, no run tossed up, nice flight, straightens a touch and is blocked
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run a flatter delivery, the googly, played off the back foot to deep cover
Rashid to Agar, no run nearly flips this up to midwicket, plays back to a shortish leg break and is a little early on his shot
Rashid to Agar, no run pushed back to the bowler
Rashid to Agar, 1 run stretches forward and tucks off the stumps to square leg
Wood to Agar, no run full at middle and off, 85mph, defended to mid-on
Wood to Agar, 1 run shuffles across the crease and works a length ball into midwicket
Wood to Jhye Richardson, no run driven to cover
Wood to Jhye Richardson, 1 run short of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to the covers for a sharp single
Wood to Agar, no run short of a length, chopped down off a bottom edge
Wood to Agar, 1 run a short delivery, Agar gets inside the line and pulls to deep square
Rashid to Agar, 2 runs full outside off, driven through the covers
Rashid to Agar, FOUR runs gets a slog-sweep away, wasn't too far away from midwicket, but places it well enough
Rashid to Agar, no run full at middle and leg, googly, defended
Rashid to Agar, no run this slides across and bounces a touch more, beats the top edge as he goes for the cut
Rashid to Agar, 1 run moves outside leg and pulls to long-on
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run flicks a straight delivery to deep square
Wood to Jhye Richardson, no run attempts a bended-knee pull shot but this scoots over the top edge
Wood to Jhye Richardson, no run short of a length at off stump, 85mph, defended on the back foot
Wood to Jhye Richardson, 1 run pushes a back-of-a-length delivery to the covers
Wood to Agar, 1 run short of a length, pulls to deep square

Wood to Jhye Richardson, 1 run a short delivery, he jumps behind the line and pushes into point. They hurry for the single and Richardson loses his bat as he nears the crease. That might have been out with a hit!
Wood to Agar, no run full at leg stump, shoveled to mid-on
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run comes down the pitch and gets a leading edge over the off side, falls safely as Bairstow comes around in the deep
Rashid to Agar, 1 run clears his front leg and drills a full delivery to long-on
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run steps back to a short delivery outside off, driven off the back foot into the covers, Roy dives and just gets a hand on it
Rashid to Agar, 1 run plays back to a googly and square drives to deep cover
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, no run that's a nice leg-break! Pitches on off stump and spins considerable to beat the edge
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, no run nicely bowled again, almost does him in the flight as he starts to use his feet, blocks to the off side
Plunkett to Agar, FOUR runs back of a length, whipped through the leg side, a short-arm pull and it races away
Plunkett to Agar, 1 run now he back cuts very nicely but it's intercepted by a diving Roy at backward point...he's been busy in the field
Plunkett to Jhye Richardson, no run goes for the drive and gets an inside edge into his boot
Plunkett to Jhye Richardson, no run beats the outside edge as he tries to play a forcing shot off the back foot
Plunkett to Jhye Richardson, 1 run works a back-of-a-length delivery towards mid-on
Plunkett to Agar, SIX runs that's out of the middle! Moves to the leg side then picks up a full delivery with a lovely swing through the line. As big as anything today
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run driven off the back foot to deep cover
Rashid to Agar, 1 run gets forward and drives to long-off
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run short outside off, driven to deep cover
Rashid to Agar, no run full outside leg, flicked into midwicket

Rashid to Agar, OUT well held! Rashid's good night continues, as he springs to his right to hold a sharp, low catch. Agar slices across the delivery slightly, came out the front of the hand, miscues it back down the pitch, Rashid takes it very neatly
Rashid to Tye, 2 runs that's almost a moonball from Rashid (remember Jeremy Snape?) So much air, very slow, loopy doopy, Tye manages to wait and drive to long-off
Ali to Jhye Richardson, 1 run tucks a straight delivery to deep square
Ali to Tye, no run defended back to the bowler
Ali to Tye, 1 run drags this from outside off out to deep midwicket
Ali to Jhye Richardson, no run pushed into the on side
Ali to Jhye Richardson, 2 runs uses his feet and then whips this from outside off wide of long-on...Richardson shapes up nicely with the bat
Rashid to Tye, 1 run pushes down the ground to long-on
Rashid to Stanlake, no run full at off stump, blocked to point
Rashid to Stanlake, 1 run starts to use his feet, doesn't get to the pitch, nudges to midwicket
Rashid to Tye, 1 run worked into square leg
Rashid to Stanlake, no run a googly, he plays back and it slides off the face to backward point

Before we leave you, here are some of the major records from today. Now we'll wrap it there for today. What a performance from England. Their thoughts will turn to 5-0 now. Australia will look to save face at Chester-le-Street and Old Trafford. We'll be back on Thursday

England have won by 242 runs and take an unbeaten 3-0 lead in the series. Don't adjust your set, that is the margin. England largest runs victory, Australia's largest runs defeat. What a performance from the home side. Utterly, utterly dominate. Jonny Bairstow, Alex Hale
England won by 242 runs
Player of the match is Alex Hales, ENG
